review_title: A good introduction to the IT Field
pros: -Hands on experience with assisting users. -Gaining more knowledge and insight on systems used for the campus. -Networking with CSUDH employees. -Acquiring experience with soft skills.
cons: -Only allowed to work 20 hours a week while enrolled in courses during the semester. -Part time.

job_title: Administrative Support Coordinator I in Carson, CA
pros: Work on an undergraduate campus; many ways to engage with the campus Great benefits
cons: Detrimental management in the department I worked in Unfair workload to competent employees

pros: Benefits are good, but you need to work there a long time.
cons: Administration isn't supportive when it comes to putting words into action, and there is a lot of red tape to get through consistently. A lot of good people have left DH because unless you're the President or a VP, you won't make enough money to warrant the workload put on you. There is little work-life balance if you have a spouse and/or kids.

review_title: Pros and Cons of CSU Dominguez Hills
pros: A lot of friendly, professional people work in the organization and their is a push for innovation and stimulating conversations to shape young minds. The benefits are excellent and there is a good pension/ retirement plan.
cons: Women have a really hard time getting tenure and full professorship and they either end up leaving, resigning and being demoted or not obtaining the status. There is definitely room for growth, mentorship and support to decrease gender discrimination on the full time professorship track and hire more full time tenure track women professors.

pros: Great people to work with
cons: Where multiple hats and oversee multiple items that may not be in your PD.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Instructor in Carson, CA
pros: The benefits package is really one of the only positives.
cons: Being an adjunct faculty is already low paying and unstable, add many students who are only interested in getting a passing grade, and an administration that doesn’t care about your well-being, and you get the recipe for burnout. That is why I no longer teach.

pros: You get consistent hours weekly if you are part-time. People are always really nice and willing to teach you things about the job and beyond the job
cons: We were only paid once a month, so it a little tougher to budget.

pros: Highest amount of minorities in both faculty and students
cons: A lack of support to Black faculties

review_title: Low pay  and  hard to be promoted
pros:
Great benefits and fee waiver 
Flexible in accommodating staff for training
a good place to gain experience 
better pay as a manager
cons: There are low opportunities to grow and obtain increases for low and middle staff. Understaffed, and most take extra duties without compensation. You must ask for gains if you are working on doing extra work. Some departments are better than others, and depending on the manager can frustrate career advancement, leading to resignation. The pay is bad for non-management positions.  It is tough to move if your department does not create opportunities.

review_title: My department is progressive and committed to continuous improvement
pros:
Good cooperation
Capable senior management
Commitment to customers (students)
Willingness to listen to new ideas and ways to accomplish work
Flexible work schedules
cons:
Compensation influenced (determined) by ineffective state legislature
Extreme budget crisis in CA is undermining the ability of the state universities to remain competitive in salary and benefit offerings
No benefits to contract staff even though they are state employees

review_title: Great population to serve. Tough administration to deal with.
pros: I love the population that we worked with - lots of low-income, first generation students of color that have overcome a lot of barriers. There are some people that are very hardworking, passionate individuals.
cons: Almost no accountability, a ton of people do not do their jobs, yet do not get fired (and a lot of them are in the union). Many people want you to either "manage up" or they micromanage, rather than providing adequate support and supervision, but also ownership. Terrible management structure with people that are stretched too thin.

review_title: It has been enjoyable working with very capable colleagues who put students' needs first
job_title: Student Services Professional in Carson, CA
pros: good staff (every department I have dealt with), management is very approachable and down to earth, very nimble and apt to adjust to current needs (although a state school). Benefits are good. Staff and students get free or discounted tickets to several Galaxy games per year.
cons: Nothing significant. DH sports restaurant is really over priced and the food is not very good. The food court does not cater to the demographics represented.

pros: on campus so you are near your school facilities
cons: manager only communicates through email, this means schedule changes, they vounteer you last minute to clean up after events, unpaid time, they never got my direct deposit information correct, the entire semester i had to come in on my off time to collect a check, and no one really provides training, they just kind of tell you to "do your best"

pros: Great organization to work for a long term growth position. The environment is stable and secure. CSU offers excellent benefits (fully paid medical, dental, vision and fee waiver for courses taken at a CSU campus)
cons: Highly political environment. In an effort to successfully complete an IT project, one must be very persistent  with follow through. Lack of knowledge transfer between groups within IT. Occasionally, tasks are completed at "state employee" speed.

pros: I've created great relationships with my supervisors.
cons: They do not care about the student's opinion on how to improve the school/ activities they hold. They treat college students like little children and not adults.

pros: The university itself is very welcoming to students and creates opportunities for student success.
cons: The leadership needs much to be desired. There are a lot of unethical actions performed by deans and other leadership members, but these are never addressed. It creates a toxic environment to work in. Non-TT faculty are not treated well. Leadership uses DH as a stepping stone to move to other places, but never to develop the school.

review_title: A good university to work for
pros: Lots of flexibility, professional atmosphere, the university is committed to focusing on the needs of the students and mentoring students to reach higher, unpretentious and supportive atmosphere for staff and faculty, full week off for all staff over winter break
cons: The campus is  difficult to reach via public transportation; too many all-staff emails

job_title: Research Help Desk Student Assistant in Carson, CA
pros: Great job. You work with academic databases, assisting individuals in finding items for research. You also help troubleshoot technical or general problems that the library patrons encounter. It is very rewarding.
cons: No opportunities for advancement. If you have a student position, you will remain at a student position and then be laid off after graduation.

job_title: Adjunct/Part-time Faculty in Long Beach, CA
pros: Great diversity of students and faculty, and the students are typically dedicated to getting a good education and value how the education will help them in the future.
cons: Some departments are not as strong as others, which is normal at any university.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Carson, CA
pros: Flexible hours, wonderful, supportive staff, intrinsically rewarding experience.
cons: Often asked to help with tasks that you may not be suited or trained to do (i.e Technical assistance), low pay (about $9.00 /hour) and you only get paid once a month.

job_title: Writing Associate Mentor in Carson, CA
pros: The work environment and culture is the best. Everyone looked forward to work. Hands-on experience in lesson planning and deployment. Great experience mentoring others to do the job.
cons: Communication among faculty and Supplemental Instruction associates needed mediation at times, but is mostly amicable.

pros: family oriented, flexible schedule, fee waivers if you want to attend school.
cons: You might gain a little weight from all the office parties.... maybe that not such a bad thing.
